definition: to show/to show off/to display/to manifest/expression/manifestation/show/display/performance (at work etc)/behavior
exterior surface/family relationship via females/to show (one's opinion)/a model/a table (listing information)/a form/a meter (measuring sth)

sentences.english: They found that the higher their level of social interaction, the better their cognitive functioning.
sentences.chinese: 他们发现，社会交往越多的人认知表现越好。

sentences.english: Ads close to top-of-the-page headlines did well.
sentences.chinese: 靠近页顶标题的广告表现良好。

sentences.english: The quite demeanor of the Capricorn is easily misinterpreted as cold and hard hearted.
sentences.chinese: 摩羯的这种表现很容易让人误解为冷漠和硬心肠。

sentences.english: Objective To improve the performance level and awareness of CT imaging with brain abscess .
sentences.chinese: 目的提高对脑脓肿CT影像学表现的认识和诊断水平。

sentences.english: In such a case, a lapse of memory will represent directly the un-invoiced services.
sentences.chinese: 在这种情况下，失误的储存表现为“不”一开单服务。

sentences.english: I am speaking English but you are acting like sheep, only looking wide-eyed.
sentences.chinese: 我讲的是英语，但你表现的像只绵羊，只是睁大眼睛。

sentences.english: Human Factors is the discipline of optimising human performance in the workplace.
sentences.chinese: 人的因素，是优化人在工作场所的表现纪律。

sentences.english: Diagnosis was established on clinical findings and the barium enema examination.
sentences.chinese: 诊断主要依靠临床表现和钡剂灌肠透视。

sentences.english: The cardinal clinical manifestation was painless solid enlargement of the testis.
sentences.chinese: 睾丸无痛性肿大为其主要临床表现。

sentences.english: Fuxin Mongolian drama has a unique form of expression and the cultural charm.
sentences.chinese: 阜新蒙古剧有着独特的表现形式和文化魅力。

sentences.english: HF radar backscatter from the ocean surface shows nonlinearities and time variation of its spectrum.
sentences.chinese: 高频波段海洋回波信号表现了非线性和频谱时变性。

sentences.english: The Fund's selection in Capital Goods and Energy detracted performance.
sentences.chinese: 我们于资本财货及能源行业的选股表现影响基金价值。

sentences.english: New employees are undependable or do not perform to expectations.
sentences.chinese: 新来的员工不可靠，或表现的不如预期。

sentences.english: The odds are that the US would stay flattish for years to come.
sentences.chinese: 在未来若干年，美国经济都会表现平平。

sentences.english: There is a raise after three months probation period according to your performance.
sentences.chinese: 三个月的试用期过后，将根据工作表现加薪。

sentences.english: Next, must display sincerely, avoids speaking insincerely.
sentences.chinese: 其次，要表现出真诚，避免言不由衷。

definition: to display/to exhibit/to bring out implicit or innate qualities/to express (a thought or moral)/to develop (an idea)/to elaborate (on a theme)
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
despite/although/even though/in spite of/unhesitatingly/do not hesitate (to ask, complain etc)/(go ahead and do it) without hesitating
also/too/(in Classical Chinese) final particle implying affirmation
to come and see/to see a topic from a certain point of view
